properties.address: Alphabetti Theatre, Tyne and Wear NE1 4HZ
properties.description: Our space is open to all with zero expectation for anyone to spend any money. Our bar/cafe has free darts, free pool, a free craft station, we have free Wi-Fi, a free library of plays, poetry and prose. We offer free tea/coffee/squash and sell the best cheese toasties in Newcastle from £4.50 (vegan options available). The first week of every Alphabetti play is always Pay What You Feel, anonymously and after the show, if you can't afford to pay, that ok we believe great art is for everyone regardless of their financial situation. All other gigs and performances offer No Questions tickets for £3. We offer captioned, audio described and relaxed performances for all Alphabetti plays.
properties.title: Alphabetti Theatre

properties.address: Baltic Centre For Contemporary Art, Gateshead, Tyne and Wear NE8 3BA
properties.description: The space is open to everyone, a warm space with access to free wi-fi, tea, coffee & juice. We offer free fruit & also gingerbread in December. Access to free books and activities that encourage re-use, recycle & creativity. Free cereal breakfast all school holidays 9.30-11.00.
properties.title: Baltic Front Room

properties.address: Birtley Methodist Church, Chester le Street, County Durham DH3 1DG
properties.description: Church hall which is warm and welcoming. Hot/cold drinks, Biscuits, accessible toilet, free wifi, charging facilities, toilets. 2-course lunch, opening times 9.30 am-1.00 pm
properties.title: Birtley Methodist church

properties.address: Rose Crescent, Bournmoor, Tyne and Wear DH4 6ED
properties.description: The space is open to all. You are welcome to join us for a hot drink and refreshments, a friendly chat and access to our small library. Any donations welcome.
properties.title: Burnmoor Parish Hall

properties.address: Carlisle Street, Gateshead, Tyne & Wear NE10 0HQ
properties.description: Our Place of Welcome offers a friendly face, hot & cold drinks, biscuits. Craft activities. Various Indoor Games

properties.address: Newcastle City Council, Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear NE6 1AL
properties.description: Café area via Poolside
properties.title: East End Pool

properties.address: Great Lumley Methodist Church, Chester le Street, County Durham DH3 4JB
properties.description: We meet on Tuesdays from 10.00am till noon then decant for a (free) hot lunch to the church hall. Friends meets all year round, by popular demand, for conversation, craft, tea/coffee, cake/biscuits. Its format is ridiculously simple but really effective. Numbers vary from 7 to 15 friends at each session and everybody loves it.
properties.title: Friends

properties.address: Alive Church, St George's, Tyne & Wear NE8 4AE
properties.description: We offer a free and warm welcome along with space to meet up, speak to others and grab a cuppa. Hope House Coffee is part of Gateshead Council’s Warm space network. Within Hope House Coffee there is signposting information available and a free community lunch.
properties.title: Hope House Coffee

properties.address: Hillside Community Hub , Gateshead, Tyne and Wear NE11 0DP
properties.description: The Warm space is open to all and is part of our cafe which is 'pay as you go'. There is also a toddler group which makes for a vibrant welcoming space
properties.title: Joshua Tree Cafe - Hillside Church

properties.address: 710A Durham Road, Gateshead, Tyne & Wear BE28 7NP
properties.description: Low Fell Library is a friendly volunteer-run community library. Everyone is welcome to browse books, use our public access computers, use the wifi on your own phone/tablet/laptop, borrow a game, or simply sit and relax.
properties.title: Low Fell Library

properties.address: St. John the Baptist's Community Hall, Jarrow, Tyne and Wear NE32 4HX
properties.description: Places of Welcome+ drop-ins are also Warm Spaces and for all people of all ages. Places of Welcome+ are warm spaces with someone to chat to where no money is needed. We also work with Community Money Advice to support visitors with money matters and our CMA Connect Team can refer to local foodbanks too. Every week we offer a free hot soup lunch, board games and crafts and in the school holidays we also offer free activities for families.
properties.title: Place of Welcome+ at St. John'Community Hall

properties.description: Refugee Drop-In is a welcoming space for refugees and those seeking asylum intended to help people rebuild their lives, thrive in their new environment and be part of our community. Citizens Advice Bureau, The British Red Cross and Mears are also present during the drop-in.
